revised_title: Chlorophyll Fluorescence and Photosystem II Reaction Centre: Origin and Quenching Mechanisms
tldr: The article discusses the origin of chlorophyll fluorescence in vivo and its quenching by the photosystem II reaction centre. The authors explore the mechanisms behind variable fluorescence and its relationship with energy transfer and electron transport in photosynthesis. They also investigate the quantum yield for the formation of the state in the absence of the electrostatic field generated by the reaction centre, providing insights into the role of this radical pair in generating fluorescence.
